Message.Title: Duplicated address
Message.Description:
The I/O configuration is invalid.
The same addresses have been given for I/O unit <> and I/O unit <>.
I/O units connected to the same I/O bus must have unique addresses.
This I/O unit has been rejected.
Message.Actions:
1. Check that addresses are correct.
2. Check that the I/O units are connected to the correct I/O bus.

Message.Title: Unit type undefined
Message.Description: The I/O configuration for I/O unit <> is invalid.
Message.Consequences: This unit type has been rejected, and no functions depending on this unit type will work.
Message.Causes: The unit type <> is unknown. All I/O units must refer to an existing, defined unit type.
Message.Actions:
1. Make sure the unit type is defined.
2. Make sure the unit type is correctly spelt.

Message.Title: I/O unit undefined
Message.Description: The I/O configuration for I/O signal <> is invalid.
Message.Consequences: This I/O signal has been rejected, and no functions depending on it will work.
Message.Causes: The I/O unit <> is unknown. All I/O signals must refer to an existing/defined I/O unit.
Message.Actions:
1. Make sure the I/O unit is defined.
2. Make sure the I/O unit name is correctly spelt.

Message.Title: Invalid filter time
Message.Description:
The I/O configuration for I/O signal <> is invalid.
The passive filter time should either be 0 ms or in the range [, ] ms.
This I/O signal has been rejected.
Message.Actions: Correct the passive filter time for the I/O signal.

Message.Title: Invalid filter time
Message.Description:
The I/O configuration for I/O signal <> is invalid.
The active filter time should either be 0 ms or in the range [, ] ms.
This I/O signal has been rejected.
Message.Actions: Correct the active filter time for the I/O signal.

Message.Title: Logical values out of range
Message.Description:
The I/O configuration for I/O signal <> is invalid.
The logical minimum value must be less than the logical maximum value.
This I/O signal has been rejected.
Message.Actions: Correct the logical values for the I/O signal so that the minimum value becomes less than the maximum value.

Message.Title: Physical values out of range
Message.Description:
The I/O configuration for I/O signal <> is invalid.
The physical minimum value must be less than the physical maximum value.
This I/O signal has been rejected.
Message.Actions: Correct the physical values for the I/O signal so that the minimum value becomes less than the maximum value.

Message.Title: Cross connection without actor I/O signal
Message.Description:
The I/O configuration is invalid.
The parameter <Actor > of one of the cross connections have been omitted.
Rules:
1. All cross connections must specify at least one actor signal, i.e. parameter <Actor I/O signal 1> must always be specified.
2. For each operator specified an actor I/O signal must follow, e.g. if parameter <Operator 2> is specified then parameter <Actor 3> must also be specified.
This cross connection has been rejected.
Message.Actions: Correct the cross connection so the required actor I/O signals are specified.

Message.Title: I/O signal undefined
Message.Description: The I/O configuration of a cross connection is invalid.
Message.Consequences: The cross connection has been rejected, and no functions depending on it will work.
Message.Causes: The parameter <Actor > of one of the cross connections contains a reference to an undefined I/O signal <>.
Message.Actions:
1. Make sure the I/O signal is defined.
2. Make sure the I/O signal name is correctly spelt.

Message.Title: Cross connection without resultant I/O signal
Message.Description:
The I/O configuration is invalid.
The parameter <Resultant I/O signal> of one of the cross connections have been omitted.
All cross connections must specify a resultant I/O signal.
This cross connection has been rejected.
Message.Actions: Correct the cross connection so that there are one resultant I/O signal per cross connection.

Message.Title: Duplicated cross connection resultants
Message.Description:
The I/O configuration is invalid.
Multiple cross connections have the same resultant I/O signal <>.
Having more than one cross connection that result in the setting of the same signal may cause unpredictable behaviours, as you cannot control their order of evaluation.
The complete cross connection configuration has been rejected.
Message.Actions: Make sure that the I/O signal is not specified as the resultant of several cross connections.

Message.Title: Closed chain in cross connection
Message.Description:
The I/O configuration is invalid.
The I/O signal <> is part of a cross connection chain that is closed (i.e. forms a circular dependence that cannot be evaluated).
The complete cross connection configuration has been rejected.
Message.Actions: Correct the configuration for the cross connections where the I/O signal above is part.

Message.Title: Cross connection max depth exceeded
Message.Description:
The I/O configuration is invalid.
The I/O signal <> is part of a cross connection chain that is too deep.
The maximum depth of a cross connection chain is <>.
The complete cross connection configuration has been rejected.
Message.Actions: Make the cross connection less deep.

Message.Title: Invalid filter specification
Message.Description:
The I/O configuration for I/O signal <> is invalid.
No filter times can be specified for this type of I/O signal.
This I/O signal has been rejected.
Message.Actions: Set filter time to 0 or remove the statement.

Message.Title: Analog I/O signal inverted
Message.Description:
The I/O configuration for I/O signal <> is invalid.
Analog I/O signals must not be inverted.
Only digital and group I/O signals can be inverted.
This I/O signal has been rejected.
Message.Actions: Remove the invert for the I/O signal (or change the signal type).

Message.Title: Cross connection with non-digital actor I/O signal
Message.Description:
The I/O configuration is invalid.
The parameter <Actor > of one of the cross connections refer to a I/O signal <>, that is not digital.
Only digital I/O signals can be cross connected.
This cross connection has been rejected.
Message.Actions: Remove the non-digital I/O signal from the cross connection.

Message.Title: Max number of cross connections exceeded
Message.Description:
The I/O configuration is invalid.
The maximum number of cross connections, ,in the I/O system has been exceeded.
Not all the cross connections have been accepted.
Message.Actions: Modify the configuration of the I/O system (by reducing the number of cross connections) so that the maximum limit is not exceeded.

Message.Title: Invalid signal type
Message.Description:
The I/O configuration for I/O signal <> is invalid.
The specified signal type <> is invalid/unknown.
Valid signal types are:
- DI (Digital input)
- DO (Digital output)
- AI (Analog input)
- AO (Analog output)
- GI (Group input)
- GO (Group output)
This I/O signal has been rejected.
Message.Actions: Correct the signal type of the I/O signal.

Message.Title: Lost communication with I/O unit
Message.Description: The previously working communication with I/O unit with address on I/O bus has been lost.
Message.Consequences: It is not possible to access the I/O unit itself or I/O signals on the I/O unit since it is currently not communicating with the controller.
Message.Causes: The I/O unit may have been disconnected from the system.
Message.Actions:
1. Make sure that the bus cable is connected to the controller.
2. Make sure the I/O unit has is correctly powered.
3. Make sure the cabling to the I/O unit is correctly connected.

Message.Title: Cannot read stored signal value
Message.Description: Cannot read the stored signal value for I/O signal <> as it is not stored.
Message.Actions: Change the configuration of the I/O signal by setting the store attribute.

Message.Title: Communication error from rtp1
Message.Description: No response from the serial line.
Message.Actions: Check the device or connection.

Message.Title: Communication error from rtp1
Message.Description: Not possible to deliver the received message.
Message.Actions: Check the communication flow.

Message.Title: Communication error from rtp1
Message.Description: The response from the device has an invalid frame sequence.
Message.Actions: Check for noise on the serial line.

Message.Title: Max number of unit types exceeded
Message.Description:
The I/O configuration is invalid.
The maximum number, , of unit types in the I/O system has been exceeded.
Message.Actions: Modify the configuration of the I/O system (by reducing the number of unit types) so that the maximum limit is not exceeded.

Message.Title: Max number of physical I/O signals exceeded
Message.Description:
The I/O configuration is invalid.
The maximum number, , of physical I/O signals (bit-mappings) in the I/O system has been exceeded.
Message.Actions: Modify the configuration of the I/O system (by reducing the number of physical I/O signals) so that the maximum limit is not exceeded.

Message.Title: Max number of user I/O signals exceeded
Message.Description:
The I/O configuration is invalid.
The maximum number, , of user I/O signals in the I/O system has been exceeded.
Message.Actions: Modify the configuration of the I/O system (by reducing the number of I/O signals) so that the maximum limit is not exceeded.

Message.Title: Max number of symbols exceeded
Message.Description:
The I/O configuration is invalid.
The maximum number, , of symbols in the I/O system has been exceeded.
The number of symbols is the sum of all namned configuration instances:
- I/O Buses
- Unit types
- I/O Units
- I/O Signals
- Command types
- Commands
- I/O Access levels
- CIP Routes
Message.Actions: Modify the configuration of the I/O system (by reducing the number of symbols) so that the maximum limit is not exceeded.

Message.Title: Max number of subscribed I/O signals exceeded
Message.Description:
The I/O configuration is invalid.
The maximum number, , of subscribed I/O signals in the I/O system has been exceeded.
Message.Actions: Modify the configuration of the I/O system (by reducing the number of subscriptions) so that the maximum limit is not exceeded.

Message.Title: Max number of I/O units exceeded
Message.Description:
The I/O configuration is invalid.
The maximum number, , of I/O units in the I/O system has been exceeded.
Message.Actions: Modify the configuration of the I/O system (by reducing the number of I/O units) so that the maximum limit is not exceeded.

Message.Title: Input I/O signal stored
Message.Description:
The I/O configuration for I/O signal <> is invalid.
Input I/O signals must not be stored.
Only output I/O signals can be stored.
This I/O signal has been rejected.
Message.Actions: Remove the store for the I/O signal (or change the signal type).

Message.Title: NFS server lost
Message.Description: The contact with the NFS server <> is lost.
Message.Actions:
1. The NFS server.
2. The network connection.
3. The NFS client.

Message.Title: Trusted NFS server lost
Message.Description: The contact with the trusted NFS server <> is lost.
Message.Actions:
1. The NFS server.
2. The network connection.
3. The NFS client.

Message.Title: Max number of I/O buses exceeded
Message.Description:
The I/O configuration is invalid.
The maximum number, , of I/O buses in the I/O system has been exceeded.
Message.Actions: Modify the configuration of the I/O system (by reducing the number of I/O buses) so that the maximum limit is not exceeded.

Message.Title: I/O bus undefined
Message.Description:
The I/O configuration for I/O unit <> is invalid.
The I/O bus <> cannot be found in the system. An I/O unit must refer to a defined I/O bus.
Installed I/O buses are:
Message.Consequences: This I/O unit has been rejected, and no functions depending on it will work.
Message.Actions:
1. Make sure the I/O bus is defined.
2. Make sure the I/O bus name is correctly spelt.

Message.Title: Interbus I/O unit failure
Message.Description: I/O unit <> at address <> reported peripheral fault. Interbus specific error code: .
Message.Consequences: The I/O unit cannot be contacted by the control system. Parts of the Interbus network will not be accessible, depending on the network topology and the nature of the fault.
Message.Causes: A number of errors may cause this. Further information may be found in the standard Interbus documentation.
Message.Actions:
1. Make sure the I/O unit at the above address is functioning correctly.
2. Check the Interbus specific error code as specified in the Interbus Manuals: Firmware Service and Error Messages.

Message.Title: Interbus bus failure
Message.Description: The control system has lost communication with the Interbus network. There is no error message from any Interbus board.
Message.Consequences: Parts of the Interbus network will not be accessible, depending on the network topology and the nature of the fault.
Message.Causes: A number of errors may cause this. Further information may be found in the standard Interbus documentation.
Message.Actions:
1. Make sure the Customer Power Supply unit, supplying the Interbus network with power, is working correctly. Replace any faulty I/O unit.
2. Make sure any fuses are correctly connected.
3. Make sure all communication cables and connectors are working correctly and of the recommended type.
4. Check network topology and cable length.
5. Restart the system.

Message.Title: Interbus bus failure
Message.Description: The control system has lost communication with the I/O unit at address <.>. Interbus specific error code: .
Message.Consequences: Parts of the Interbus network will not be accessible, depending on the network topology and the nature of the fault.
Message.Causes: A number of errors may cause this. Further information may be found in the standard Interbus documentation.
Message.Actions:
1. Make sure the I/O unit at the above address is functioning correctly.
2. Check the Interbus specific error code as specified in the Interbus Manuals: Firmware Service and Error Messages.

Message.Title: ID code mismatch
Message.Description: The ID code <> read from Interbus I/O unit <> doesn't match the expected value from the unit type configuration.
Message.Consequences: The I/O unit has not been configured, and cannot be used by the system.
Message.Causes: Wrong ID code value may have been introduced to the system parameters. The Interbus network may have been configured with a I/O unit with the wrong ID code.
Message.Actions:
Check the ID code of the I/O unit's unit type in the system parameters. How to check the configuration file is detailed in the Trouble Shooting Manual.
2. Replace the I/O unit with another using the correct ID code in the Interbus configuration as specified in the supplier's documentation.
3. Specify a generic unit type in the system parameters: ibsGeneric and ibsSlave.

Message.Title: Invalid IP address
Message.Description: The IP address <> is not valid.
Message.Actions: Check the Communication configuration.

Message.Title: Invalid subnet mask
Message.Description: The subnet mask <> is not valid.
Message.Actions: Check the Communication configuration.

Message.Title: Deactivated I/O unit with Unit Trustlevel <Required (0)>
Message.Description:
The I/O configuration of I/O unit <> is invalid.
I/O units with Unit Trustlevel Required (0) are not allowed to be Deactivated.
Message.Consequences: This I/O unit has been rejected, and no functions depending on it will work.
Message.Actions: Correct the configuration of the I/O unit by either Activating it or changing the Unit Trustlevel.

Message.Title: Incorrect IP address
Message.Description: The address <> in protocol <> is not a correct IP address.
Message.Actions: Correct the address.

Message.Title: No transmission protocol
Message.Description: The transmission protocol <> given for application protocol <> could not be found.
Message.Actions: Change the transmission protocol.

Message.Title: Mount Permission denied
Message.Description: Permission was denied to mount the directory <> on the server <>.
Message.Actions: Change the User or Group ID.

Message.Title: Directory not exported
Message.Description:
Mounting directory <> as <> failed since it is not exported on the server computer <>.
Protocol: <>.
Message.Actions: Export the directory on the server computer.

Message.Title: Ethernet not installed
Message.Description: The Ethernet Services option has to be installed when using remote mounted disk.
Message.Actions: Reboot and install the Ethernet Services option.

Message.Title: Too many remote disks
Message.Description:
The maximum number of remote mounted disks have been exceeded.
The maximum number is .
Message.Actions: Reduce the number of remote mounted disks.

Message.Title: Too many remote servers
Message.Description:
The maximum number of servers for remote mounted disks have been exceeded.
The maximum number is .
Message.Actions: 1. Reduce the number of servers.

Message.Title: Could not mount directory
Message.Description:
Mounting directory <> on the computer <> failed.
Protocol: <>.
Message.Actions: Check the server setup.

Message.Title: Default value for I/O signal out of range
Message.Description:
The I/O configuration for I/O signal <> is invalid.
The default value is out of range.
This I/O signal has been rejected.
Message.Actions: Change the default value for the I/O signal.

Message.Title: Interbus bus has been deactivated
Message.Description: The Interbus bus has switched to a none running mode.
Message.Actions:
Restart the system.
2. Check that correct Interbus boot project is selected.

Message.Title: No response from the Interbus network
Message.Description: Access to the Interbus network is denied.
Message.Actions:
1. Check the Interbus board.
2. Check the internal Interbus configuration.
3. Reduce the cycle time on the slave I/O unit.

Message.Title: No access to the Interbus network
Message.Description: Access to the Interbus service interface is denied during , error code is 0x.
Message.Actions:
1. Check the internal Interbus configuration.
2. The Interbus may be faulty. Replace any faulty I/O unit if required.

Message.Title: IPC queue full
Message.Description: The interprocess communication (IPC) queue <> was full, when sending to trap routine.
Message.Actions: Restart the system.

Message.Title: Address out of range
Message.Description:
The I/O configuration is invalid.
The address of I/O unit <> is invalid (out of range).
This I/O unit has been rejected.
Message.Actions:
1. Change the address.
2. Check the address syntax.

Message.Title: I/O signal on internal I/O unit
Message.Description:
The I/O configuration is invalid.
The user-defined I/O signal <> must not be connected to the internal I/O unit <>
User defined I/O signals are not allowed to be connected to internal I/O units.
This I/O signal has been rejected.
Message.Actions: Connect the I/O signal to another I/O unit.

Message.Title: Internal I/O signal in cross connection
Message.Description:
The I/O configuration contains an invalid cross connection.
The <Actor > is a user-defined I/O signal whereas the resultant I/O signal <> is an internal I/O signal.
It is not allowed to define cross connections where user-defined I/O signals affect internal I/O signals.
Message.Actions: Correct the cross connection so that there are no internal I/O signals in the resultant expression.

Message.Title: FTP server went down
Message.Description:
The connection to a non-trusted FTP server has been lost.
IP address: <>.
Message.Actions: Check cable and FTP server settings.

Message.Title: FTP server went down
Message.Description:
The connection to a trusted FTP server has been lost.
IP address: <>.
Message.Actions: Check cable and FTP server settings.

Message.Title: Wrong transmission protocol
Message.Description: No matching transmission protocol was found in the configuration.
Message.Actions: Change the transmission protocol.

Message.Title: Ethernet not installed
Message.Description: The option Ethernet Services with FTP is not installed on this system.
Message.Actions: Reboot and install the Ethernet Services with FTP option.

Message.Title: I/O signal undefined
Message.Description:
The I/O configuration is invalid.
The parameter <Resultant I/O signal> of one of the cross connections contains a reference to an undefined I/O signal <>.
This cross connection has been rejected.
Message.Actions: Correct the cross connection so that the resultant I/O signal refers to an existing I/O signal.

Message.Title: Cross connection with invalid operator
Message.Description:
The I/O configuration is invalid.
The parameter <Operator > of one of the cross connections contains an invalid/unknown operator <>.
Valid values for the logical operator are:
- AND
- OR
This cross connection has been rejected.
Message.Actions: Correct the operator.

Message.Title: Duplicated name
Message.Description:
The I/O configuration is invalid.
The identifier <> has already been used as the name of another configuration instance.
The following configuration instances must have unique names:
- I/O Buses
- Unit types
- I/O Units
- I/O Signals
- Command types
- Commands
- I/O Access levels
- CIP Routes
This configuration instance has been rejected.
Message.Actions:
1. Rename one of the configuration instances in system parameters.
2. Restart the system.

Message.Title: Invalid physical I/O mapping
Message.Description:
I/O mapping error on I/O unit <>.
The I/O unit uses an input size of < bits, the controller can handle maximum > bits.
The I/O unit uses an output size of < bits, the controller can handle maximum > bits.
Message.Actions: Check configuration for the physical I/O unit.

Message.Title: Invalid encoding type
Message.Description:
The I/O configuration for I/O signal <> is invalid.
The encoding type <> is not valid for signal type <>.
Valid encoding types are:
- UNSIGNED
- TWO_COMP
This I/O signal has been rejected.
Message.Actions: Correct the encoding type for the I/O signal.

Message.Title: Unknown I/O bus
Message.Description:
The I/O configuration is invalid.
The I/O bus <> cannot be found in the system.
Installed I/O buses are:
Message.Consequences: This I/O bus has been rejected, and no functions depending on it will work.
Message.Actions:
1. Make sure the system has been configured with the desired I/O bus.
2. Make sure the I/O bus option at hand is installed.
3. Check the configuration for I/O bus.

Message.Title: Could not mount directory
Message.Description:
Mounting directory <> on the computer <> failed.
Protocol: <>.
Message.Actions:
1. Check the FTP server setup.
2. Check the FTP client configuration.
3. Check communication hardware, cabling.

Message.Title: No Profibus option has been installed
Message.Description: A Profibus-DP master/slave board has been fitted, but no Profibus option has been installed.
Message.Consequences: No communication on the Profibus is possible. There may be consequential errors from configuring Profibus when no such option has been installed.
Message.Causes: An attempt may have been made to add the Profibus functionality, without installing the option correctly.
Message.Actions:
1. If the Profibus option is required: configure a new system with this option, and install the system.
2. If the Profibus option is not required: configure a new system without this option, and install the system.

Message.Title: Profibus firmware file not found
Message.Description:
The Profibus <> firmware file not found or not readable.
The board firmware may be out of date.
Message.Actions: Reinstall the system.

Message.Title: Profibus configuration file not found
Message.Description:
The binary Profibus configuration file was not found.
- File: <>
- Path: <>.
Message.Actions:
1. Make sure the file exists.
2. Change the path in the I/O configuration.

Message.Title: Profibus file parse error
Message.Description:
The binary Profibus configuration file is corrupt. (Internal error: )
- File: <>
- Path: <>.
Message.Actions: Recreate and download the binary configuration file using the external Profibus configuration tool.

Message.Title: Profibus channel has been reflashed
Message.Description: The channel firmware of the Profibus board has been updated from <> to <>.

Message.Title: Profibus configuration error
Message.Description: The local slave channel has more DI/DO than the configuration in its master.
Message.Actions: Make the number of DI/DO of the external Profibus master more or equal than the local slave.

Message.Title: Profibus configuration ok
Message.Description: The number of DI/DO of the external Profibus master is now more or equal than for the I/O unit of DP_SLAVE type.

Message.Title: Initialization of Profibus slave failed
Message.Description: The slave channel on the Profibus-DP master/slave board did not start up correctly.
Message.Consequences: No communication on the Profibus slave channel is possible.
Message.Causes: The board hardware may be malfunctioning.
Message.Actions:
1. Restart the system.
2. Replace the Profibus slave board if faulty.

Message.Title: Profibus binary configuration fault
Message.Description: The configuration data in the binary file is not accepted by the slave at address <>.
Message.Actions: Make the configuration data in the binary file match the configuration for the slave and reboot the system

Message.Title: Profibus binary parameter fault
Message.Description: The parameter data in the binary file is not accepted by the slave at address <>.
Message.Actions: Make the parameter data in the binary file match the parameters for the slave and reboot the system.

Message.Title: I/O unit configuration error
Message.Description: I/O unit <> is configured in system parameters but is missing or incorrect in Profibus binary file.
Message.Actions:
1. Check/change system parameters.
2. Check/change Profibus binary file.

Message.Title: Wrong Profibus I/O unit is connected
Message.Description: Profibus I/O unit <> at address <> has the wrong identity number. Reported identity number is . Expected identity number is .
Message.Consequences: The system will not be able to Activate the I/O unit and no communication on the Profibus will be possible.
Message.Causes:
-The I/O unit at address <> may be the wrong type of I/O unit.
-The configuration may be incorrect, i.e. an incorrect binary configuration file and in some cases incorrect system parameters.
Message.Actions:
1. Make sure the system parameters are correct.
2. Make sure the Profibus binary file is correct.
3. Replace the I/O unit.
